body.p: The undersigned citizens of Estill, Owsley, Breathitt, Perry, Letcher, Harlan & Clay would respectfully ask that at least three (3) of the companies of the "Three Forks Bat." be retained in the service for two or three months longer at least -- We ask especially that Capt. Cardwell be not now mustered out, -- we would also ask that Capt. Combs & Blankinships companies be retained --

At present we have peace and quiet in the counties named, but the guerrillas are only suppressed for the present and in consequence of the presence of Union forces & should they be mustered out they will again appear and we fear in a worse and more desperate warfare than hertofore -- If the troops are all mustered out it will leave us in a worse condition than when the forces now here were formed. We hope and trust you will not disregard this petition -- The whole Batallion is now here representing the whole country from this to the Virginia line and are exceedingly anxious that you should be here on Monday next and Make them a speach -- If you will come, you will have a large crowd We will expect you -- You have ere this recd a letter from citizens of this county scoleciting you to 'be here Monday -- Please
answer immediately --

Respectfully
Isaac N. Cardwell
R. B. Jameson
J. B. Ashcroft
P, D, Scholl
Thos H Carson
Carter Jett
G Thurden
Thomas Sewell
Francis M Vaughn Cap Co
'B' Three Forks Bat
W S Thompson
H J Arnold Lt Co 'B'
D, B, Scholl
Philip Harrison
Caldwell Oaks 1st Lieut Co. B.
